page.title: 01INTRODUCTION TO DOLPINTON
page.content: Dolphinton is a rural village which lies astride the main road between Edinburgh and Biggar. The landscape ranges from heather hill 1,600 feet high, through varied woodland, grassland, arable crops. Burns flow to River Tweed in the south-east and River Clyde in the north-west. There is a village hall, primary school, church, part-time post office, but unfortunately the village shop has closed. During winter, Women's Rural, Badminton and Carpet Bowling clubs are held in the hall. Population includes 30 pensioners, 100 adults, and 34 children. Employment is as farmers, farm workers, and associated industries eg. haulage. Half of the adult workers travel outwith the village to work. Farms are mixed beef, sheep and arable, with one dairy.
